message: Dungeon master has to pay for what he did to me and my family. But I can't fight him like this. Let's see what is in the nearest town. Maybe I can find some useful gear there.
There is a lot of shed grey fur on the ground. Surely someone lives here...
Wolves. Should have seen it coming. On the other hand, these coins would become useful later.

The cursed fog thins behind me, and I feel the ground shift — no longer damp and cold, but dry, cracked, and burning hot beneath my feet. I climb a ridge and see it: rivers of lava carving paths through blackened stone, smoke rising from vents in the earth, and far in the distance… a dark fortress built into the side of a roaring volcano. That’s where he is. The Dungeon Master. The one who destroyed everything. I grip my weapon tighter. This is it — no more running, no more searching. I’m coming for him.

The town is small but bustling. Merchants shout their offers, children run through the streets, and adventurers gather by the fountain swapping tales. The smell of fresh bread and hot steel fills the air.
The blacksmith eyes you with curiosity as you enter. "You look like someone heading into trouble," he says. "Good. Trouble pays well."
"I can’t afford much, but anything’s better than bare fists and rags."
Hint: Select "E" to enter shop while in town

I push through the last stretch of swamp, boots soaked and stinking, but still moving. The air changes — heavier, colder, like it’s watching me. Dead trees stretch like claws from the cracked earth ahead, and a sickly mist coils around my legs. This must be the Cursed Land. Every instinct tells me to turn back… but I’ve come too far for that. Whatever haunts this place, I’ll face it. I have no choice.
Hint: equip "Mana Potion" and use it when you are in battle to gain mana and use spells.

I spot a narrow trail winding down into a scorched valley — a town, barely standing against the heat and ash. Smoke rises from its forge, and worn banners flap weakly in the sulfur-stained wind. It’s close… but not too close to the Dungeon Master’s fortress. Just enough time to prepare. I’ve come a long way, but if I charge in now, I’ll die just like the others. I need better gear, supplies — anything to give me an edge. One last stop before the final fight.

I leave the town behind, and the dirt path quickly turns slick beneath my boots. Up ahead, a dense swamp stretches into the distance — murky water, twisted trees, and fog that clings to the ground like it’s alive. I slow my pace. This place looks like it swallows fools whole. I don’t know what’s waiting in there, but I have to cross it if I want to reach him. Question is… can I make it through in one piece?
Hint: Go to inventory and equip item in order to get it's bonuses. In order to use a potion during the fight, it has to be equipped in the inventory.

I stand at the edge of the final path. Behind me, scorched hills and ash-covered memories. Ahead, the gates of the Dungeon Master’s fortress rise like jagged teeth from the volcano’s mouth, glowing faintly with heat and malice. The ground trembles with every breath that place takes. This is it. No more shops, no more resting, no more turning back. I came all this way for justice — for revenge. Whatever waits inside, I’m ready. I have to be.
